channel.title: Auxy Synthesiser?
channel.description:
I know a synthesiser is a huge feature to implement; but I feel it would put Auxy up there as a serious DAW (not that it isn't already of course ðŸ˜‰). Auxy uses the preset-tweaking model used by many other desktop DAWs, but differs by having no way to create your own wave. I would personally suggest a wavetable synth due to - and this is subjective but hey ho - it's ease of use. Starting with a complex wave and applying modifiers and effects until you have your sound is usually very intuitive and ends up with a polished/finished sound.
**Edit** Just noticed wavetable synthesis has been implemented very effectively for the Europa synth in the Reason Compact iOS app â€” which I highly recommend you guys go explore!
What do you all think about this idea?

item.title: Auxy Synthesiser?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
DX100 From Mars - Thoughts? Auxy Feedback
Weâ€™re shipping new content since itâ€™s a core part of the subscription offering and a great way to expand the capabilities of the app without making it more complex. And weâ€™re trying to level up the pack quality and add more variety over time. Weâ€™re also constantly working on improving the app and keeping it fresh. That doesnâ€™t necessarily mean redesigning it or adding a lot of big features, though. Itâ€™s always exciting with new tools, but we want to keep focused on the things we believe will siâ€¦

I mean I agree, but yeah, funny that someone posts exactly this today and itâ€™s answered on the other thread hahaâ€¦

And PS yeah, Europa in Reason Compact is one of the best sounding on iOS

item.title: Auxy Synthesiser?
item.dc:creator: benjd
item.description:
I guess another option would be to build an Auxy sampler so we could at least import a WAV sample of our favourite patches.
Iâ€™m aware the Auxy drum machine has external sample and pitch shifting functionality, but not in a way suitable for an instrument.

item.title: Auxy Synthesiser?

item.description:
I know a synthesiser is a huge feature to implement; but I feel it would put Auxy up there as a serious DAW (not that it isnâ€™t already of course ). Auxy uses the preset-tweaking model used by many other desktop DAWs, but differs by having no way to create your own wave.
I would personally suggest a wavetable synth due to - and this is subjective but hey ho - itâ€™s ease of use. Starting with a complex wave and applying modifiers and effects until you have your sound is usually very intuitive and ends up with a polished/finished sound.

Edit
Just noticed wavetable synthesis has been implemented very effectively for the Europa synth in the Reason Compact iOS app â€” which I highly recommend you guys go explore!
